title: 1988–89 Cypriot First Division
text:
The 1988–89 Cypriot First Division was the 50th season of the Cypriot top-level <a href="Association%20football">football</a> league. <a href="AC%20Omonia">Omonia</a> won their 16th title.
Format.
Fifteen teams participated in the 1988–89 Cypriot First Division. All teams played against each other twice, once at their home and once away. The team with the most points at the end of the season crowned champions. The last three teams were relegated to the <a href="1989%E2%80%9390%20Cypriot%20Second%20Division">1989–90 Cypriot Second Division</a>.
The champions ensured their participation in the <a href="1989%E2%80%9390%20European%20Cup">1989–90 European Cup</a> and the runners-up in the <a href="1989%E2%80%9390%20UEFA%20Cup">1989–90 UEFA Cup</a>.
Point system.
Teams received two points for a win, one point for a draw and zero points for a loss.
Changes from previous season.
<a href="APEP%20Limassol">APEP</a>, <a href="Alki%20Larnaca%20F.C.">Alki</a> and <a href="Anagennisi%20Deryneia">Anagennisi</a> were relegated from previous season and played in the <a href="1988%E2%80%9389%20Cypriot%20Second%20Division">1988–89 Cypriot Second Division</a>. They were replaced by the first two teams of the <a href="1987%E2%80%9388%20Cypriot%20Second%20Division">1987–88 Cypriot Second Division</a>, <a href="Keravnos%20Strovolou%20FC">Keravnos</a> and <a href="Omonia%20Aradippou">Omonia Aradippou</a>.
